content.title: Optimism in China after US trade thaw but hard work just starting - Al Jazeera English
content.desc: Beijing, China - A sense of relief spread across China as President Xi Jinping and his United States counterpart, Donald Trump, agreed over the weekend to a 90-day halt to new tariffs as the world's two leading economies engage in new negotiations aimed at reaching a broader deal. The smiles and friendly handshakes exchanged between the two leaders on the sidelines of a Group of 20 meeting in Argentina contrasted sharply with the testy exchanges and thinly-veiled animosity that had for months defined the US-China relations amid a bitter tit-for-tat trade dispute.
